common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch after updating, often getting stuck on "ensure core dependencies." This issue primarily affects Windows users and is linked to a buggy migration process, potentially conflicting with OneDrive. Reinstalling with the latest build (11.1.1) or using an alternative installer often resolves the issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

my pieces os was working but now its not working. when i install it it was working after upfate its not working
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key point:** Danica121 reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching.

**Problem:** Duplicate of existing issue #625.

**Solutions:**
* Pieces team is actively working on a hotfix.
* User is advised to be patient.

**Current status:** Issue is acknowledged and being addressed.

**Outcome:** Awaiting hotfix release.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Pieces OS v11.1.1 not launching for some users

**Key points:**

* Users experiencing issues launching Pieces OS v11.1.1
* Issue related to stricter hardware requirements in v11.1.1
* Support team investigating and collecting user logs

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* User asked to provide logs from c://Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/Support
* Support team working on a patch to resolve the issue

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch expected to be released by end-of-day on February 13th

**Additional Information:**

* Related issues: #131, #620, #456

**Resources:**

* Existing Issues: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues
* Documentation: https://docs.pieces.app
* YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@getpieces

**Note:** This summary is based on the information available in the provided conversation and may not reflect all aspects of the issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on PiecesOS Boot-up Issues:

### Key Points Raised:

* Some users experienced delays in PiecesOS booting up, sometimes getting stuck on the "ensure core dependencies" step.
* This issue seemed to be more prevalent on Windows machines.
* Users reported seeing the PiecesOS icon appear briefly in the system tray before disappearing.
* One user reported seeing a web page warning that PiecesOS couldn't start and suggesting a restart.
* Another user mentioned running Atlas OS alongside Windows, which may have been a contributing factor.

### Identified Problems:

* A bug in the PiecesOS migration process caused delays and potential hangs during boot-up.
* Conflicts with OneDrive could prevent the database from migrating properly.
* The PiecesOS installer potentially had issues on some Windows machines.

### Proposed/Implemented Solutions:

* The Pieces team released a new build (11.1.1) that addressed the migration bug and the OneDrive conflict.
* Users were advised to uninstall and reinstall PiecesOS with the new build.
* An alternative app installer was provided for download.
* The team asked users to report back if they were still experiencing issues after the update.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* The issue appears to be resolved for most users who updated to build 11.1.1.
* One user reported that the issue was still occurring, but it was later determined to be a long-standing issue with OneDrive that was resolved separately.
* The team is working on a patch to prevent the OneDrive conflict from happening again in future builds.

### Additional Notes:

* This issue was initially reported on MacOS Monterey, but it turned out to be primarily a Windows issue.
* The conversation highlights the importance of clear communication and collaboration between users and the support team in identifying and resolving issues.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS v11.1.1 launch failure due to AVX2
common_issues.description: Users are reporting PiecesOS v11.1.1 fails to launch on systems without AVX2 support. This impacts both Windows and MacOS users. The issue stems from a new dependency on AVX2 in the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension. The Pieces team is working on a patch to address this and expects to release a fix shortly.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Conversation Summary: PiecesOS Boot Issue on macOS

**Key Points Raised:**

* User is experiencing boot issues with PiecesOS on macOS. 
* The system is running on an Intel Core i5-3210M CPU.

**Problems Identified:**

* The new vector library in PiecesOS requires AVX2 support, which is not available on the user's CPU.
* This is preventing the application from launching.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* PiecesOS development team is actively working on a solution for this issue.
* A release with a fix is expected to be released tomorrow.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing, but a fix is expected to be released soon.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is encouraged to try the new release once it is available.
* The team appreciates the user's patience and contribution to making Pieces better.

**Action Items:**

* Wait for the new release of PiecesOS.
* Test the new release and report any further issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `GetReal444` is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces OS application.
* An error message related to the `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension and AVX2 incompatibility is present in the logs.

**Problems Identified:**

* The `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension requires AVX2 processor support, which is not available on the user's machine.
* This issue is impacting multiple users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on a solution to address the AVX2 dependency issue.
* A patch is expected to be released within 24-48 hours.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being actively addressed by the Pieces team.
* Users are advised to check for updates and provide their machine's technical specifications.
* A fix is expected to be released by the end of the day on February 13th, 2025.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is related to issues #624 and #625.
* The conversation indicates that the Pieces team is actively engaged in resolving the issue and communicating with affected users.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up Failure and Desktop App Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to boot, getting stuck on "ensure core dependencies" or failing to launch the Desktop App. This was often due to outdated builds, conflicting processes, or incorrect architecture downloads. Solutions included updating to the latest build, killing conflicting processes, and reinstalling using the correct architecture-specific download.

related_issues.title: core services
related_issues.text:
core services

### Early Access Program

i had no issues with it in the begining but now when i try to open it now i encounter this error message 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e929cf56-d8a1-4185-8167-867ede2048e7)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @C2mokete created an issue regarding PiecesOS experiencing long boot-up times.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces support team.
* Existing related issues and helpful resources were provided.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up, preventing users from running it.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions explicitly mentioned in the conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user will be contacted by the Pieces team within 24 hours.

**Additional Notes:**

* The linked issues suggest potential solutions:
    * Updating core dependencies in the Desktop application.
    * Checking for compatibility with MacOS Sequoia 15.2.

**Overall, the issue remains open and requires troubleshooting by the Pieces support team.**

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Fails to Boot (Unable to Run)

**Key Points:**

* PASimmons reported issues with PiecesOS failing to boot on their M1 Mac.
* The support team suspected outdated builds, conflicting processes, or incorrect architecture mismatch as potential causes.

**Problems Identified:**

* PASimmons was using an outdated build of Pieces for Developers and PiecesOS.
* Conflicting processes like `pieces_qdrant_server` might have interfered with the launch.
* The user's Mac architecture (Apple Silicon) might not have been compatible with the build they were using.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark at Pieces suggested the following:
    * Kill conflicting processes in Activity Monitor.
    * Provide support logs for further analysis.
    * Reinstall Pieces for Developers and PiecesOS using the correct architecture-specific download links from the Pieces website.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* PASimmons confirmed they reinstalled using the correct download link for Apple Silicon.
* The issue was resolved with Pieces for Developers running successfully.
* Mark at Pieces marked the issue as resolved and referred to ongoing announcements for further updates.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation highlights the importance of using the correct architecture-specific builds for PiecesOS and Pieces for Developers.
* Users encountering similar issues should refer to the provided resources and follow the troubleshooting steps suggested by the support team.

## End of Summary

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Desktop App Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various performance issues with the PiecesOS Desktop app, including slow boot-up, freezing, and unresponsiveness. These issues were observed across different operating systems (macOS, Windows, Linux) and were often related to software updates, core dependencies, and conflicts with other applications like OneDrive. Solutions included updating to the latest PiecesOS build, reinstalling the app, disabling conflicting software features, and waiting for bug fixes from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Renaming conversations not working as expected. 

**Key points raised:**

* User (@seantiz) reported that renaming conversations was not working as expected. 
* Support bot acknowledged and routed the issue to the relevant team.
* Support engineer (@mack-at-pieces) confirmed the issue and informed about an upcoming fix.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A patch was released for copilot and desktop app (versions v3.3.5 and 3.3.6).

**Current status/outcome:**

* User confirmed that the issue has been resolved after updating to the latest version. 

**Additional notes:**

* The issue was identified on January 17, 2025.
* The patch was released by February 10, 2025. 

## Conclusion

The issue with renaming conversations has been successfully addressed and resolved with the latest update.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

* Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint
* Caused by specific versions of Linux Mint and TextFields in Flutter (Flutter issue #153560)
* Affected users with on-screen keyboards

**Solutions:**

* Disable the virtual keyboard in accessibility settings (workaround)
* Wait for a Flutter hotfix to be implemented in Pieces

**Outcome:**

* User successfully resolved the issue by disabling the virtual keyboard.
* Pieces team will monitor the situation and apply a fix when available through Flutter updates.
* Issue closed for now.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is related to existing issues #584, #613, and #456.
* Helpful resources provided include existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Performance and Stability Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported high CPU usage, unresponsiveness, and launch failures in Pieces OS 11.1.1 on Linux and Windows. Proposed solutions include disabling LTM-1, waiting for Flutter updates, and a patch for launch failures. The Pieces team is actively investigating and addressing these issues.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS has high CPU usage even when idle and no LLM output is processing. Closing the desktop app or any other app with integrations like VScode makes no difference. The CPU usage sometimes drops down to 0% but immediately picks up back to 90%+. 
I dont have any local LLMs or any of the browser plugins installed. I am aware that similar issue was raised last year and was supposed to be fixed in 11.1.0, maybe it wasn't fixed entirely.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bedac0a-c9aa-48b9-a86a-6a3c4698d263
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Memory Usage Concerns

**Key points raised:**

* User @94tejas reported high RAM and CPU usage in the Pieces app.
* This issue has been observed by other users as well (see related issues).

**Problems identified:**

* The Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM-1) is likely causing high resource usage.
* LTM-1 is a valuable feature but can be resource-intensive on lower-powered devices.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Turning off LTM-1 is a temporary solution.
* A feature to optimize LTM-1 is under development.
* Ability to opt into cloud processing for LTM-1 is also being developed.
* Turning on "cloud only" mode for enrichment can further reduce resource consumption.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User @94tejas confirmed that disabling LTM-1 resolved the issue.
* Once complete, the LTM-1 optimization and cloud processing features will provide more permanent solutions.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation took place in February 2025.
* The conversation is between the user, Pieces support bot, and a Pieces team member. 
* The conversation demonstrates good communication and support from the Pieces team.

recommendations: **Prioritize addressing launch failures:** The most frequent and active tickets revolve around PiecesOS launch failures, particularly after the 11.1.1 update. Focus on resolving these issues urgently to minimize user disruption.

**Improve communication about AVX2 requirement:** Clearly communicate the new AVX2 requirement for PiecesOS v11.1.1 on both download pages and release notes. Provide guidance for users with unsupported systems.

**Investigate and address performance issues:** Several reports mention high CPU usage, unresponsiveness, and slow boot-up. Investigate these issues systematically, potentially focusing on LTM-1 and interactions with specific operating systems and applications.
**Review OneDrive interaction:** Issues related to OneDrive conflicts during PiecesOS installation and migration persist. Review and optimize this interaction to prevent future occurrences.

**Enhance documentation for common issues:** Create or update support articles addressing the common issues identified, such as launch failures, AVX2 incompatibility, and OneDrive conflicts. Provide clear troubleshooting steps for users.
